result.execSummary:
The defendant Adalberto Jimenez Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $100 drug testing fee

**10/19/22: Per Court's order at sentencing and Attorney Huebner's Final Statement of Hours, Defendant to reimburse attorney fees in the amount of $127.50, in addition to attorney fees assessed on original Judgment of Conviction.**
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician

--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment & as deemed appropriate per Agent

--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to comply with DNA sample provision

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adalberto Jimenez Ortiz

records.addlTxt: Final Statement of service hours in the amount of 1.5 hours submitted by contract Attorney Karl E. Huebner.
w/ elements and ccs

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission

[ma] Case called at 10:02am 
Defendant Adalberto Jimenez Ortiz in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Adalberto Jimenez Ortiz.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by ADA Teuber

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment & as deemed appropriate per Agent
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $100 drug testing fee

Days credit for time already served: 3  days
recess: 10:18am

Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on January 5, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on January 9, 2023 at 08:15 am.

[ml] Case called at 10:55AM
Defendant Adalberto Jimenez Ortiz in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Sylvie Dahnert sworn in.

The Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to both Counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Att Huebner requests that a Jury Trial be scheduled, stating that the State Crime Lab will not test the substance in question without a Jury Trial being scheduled. 

recess 11:03AM

(2) Final Status Conference on 01/05/2023 at 9:30AM 
(3) Jury Trial on 01/09/2023 at 8:15AM

[ma] Case called at 10:38 AM 
Defendant Adalberto Jimenez Ortiz in court.  Student Practioner Hailey Shelton undert the supervision of Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant.

The Court directs that Mr. Jimenez complete and submit petiton for court appointed counsel since is not eligible for public defender representation. 

recess:10:42am 
NEXT: Status on 7/5/22 at 11:30am
Entry made in error
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--not use or possess controlled substances without a valid prescription
--not possess drug paraphernalia

[ml] Case called at 1:31PM
Defendant Adalberto Jimenez Ortiz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def does not qualify). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Shawn Stevenoski sworn in [She appears via telephone].
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. Right to counsel is given.
The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits, preserves all the Defendant's jurisdictional objections, and sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel hearing.

On Motion of the Defense, the Court goes off the briefly record to evaluate the Defendant for a Court appointed attorney. After evaluation, the Court finds that the Defendant is ineligible for a Court appointed attorney.

The Court requires a $750.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--not use or possess controlled substances without a valid prescription
--not possess drug paraphernalia

recess 1:50PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 06/20 at 10:30AM with in person appearances
